attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Food Supplements Directive requires the European Union to establish maximum permitted levels for vitamins and minerals in food supplements. The levels will apply throughout the whole of the European Union. Whilst this may remove barriers to trade between different member states, there is a real risk that the levels will be set so low as to make illegal many safe, popular and effective vitamin and mineral supplements that are currently available, and have been for over 40 years in the United Kingdom Market place.    The European Commission has delayed publishing its proposed figures to avoid causing panic to British and Irish consumers in the run up to the recent European Parliament elections and the forthcoming Referendum in Ireland, but they are expected to be published later this year.   We would urge The Prime Minister to personally intervene to lobby Europe to ensure that UK consumers do not lose their higher potency supplements, and a whole industry comprising of High Street shops, suppliers and manufacturers do not go out of business.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "personally intervene to ensure that the European Union does not set unnecessarily restrictive maximum permitted levels for vitamins and minerals in food supplements since this would restrict the ability of consumers to choose higher dose supplements which may help achieve and maintain optimum health. The legislation will also have a detrimental effect on independent health food retailers and other periphery industries."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
